page.title: 11SHOPPING:THORNTON CLEVELEYS
page.content: ON SUNDAY,JULY 14TH 1985,ON A DRIZZLY MORNING I CYCLED ROUND THIS AREA TO COLLECT EVIDENCE OF SHOPPING FACILITIES. THE FIRST TWO AREAS WERE BUNGALOW ESTATES BUILT FOR RETIRED PEOPLE AND EACH OFFERED SIMILAR SERVICES: POST OFFICE, HAIRDRESSER,FOOD,OFF-LICENCE AND DURABLE GOODS. IN THE OTHER TWO AREAS THE EXTRA SERVICES WERE MAINLY ELECTRICAL GOODS. THERE WAS ONLY ONE CHEMIST IN THE WHOLE AREA SURVEYED. IN AN AGE OF SUPER-STORES AND PRIVATE TRANSPORT,SHOPPING SEEMS TO HAVE BECOME SOMETHING OF AN ENTERTAINMENT AND ONE WONDERS HOW MUCH LONGER SMALL TRADERS CAN CONTINUE TO SURVIVE.THEY MUST,I SUPPOSE,TRY TO OFFER SPECIALIST SERVICES. BY{MRS.A.PITCHERS,TEACHER,NORTHFOLD }
